channel.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
channel.description:
Well as you know, well mabye not, but people keep getting keyloggers/trojans when they can stop it in early stages!!
One thing is that before the virus itself will ruin ur comp badly is that youll get a fake bubble on your toolbar thing on corner next to the time. It will be a bigger red sheild than other virus bubble and windows bubbles. This is the virus, not windows. The shield will have a white "X" on it telling you that ur comp is infected. First thing you is scan your comp with GOOD software. NOT ONES THAT YOU GOT FREE OR 99 cents! Make sure it is a good scanner. I use McAfee and it helps me everytime. Remember do NOT click the bubble. This is just activate the virus/trojan. If you do, then you have a bad chance of getting out but a good one in a sense.
Basic virus info.
There are many viruses. There are worms, trojans, keyloggers, ect ect. Basic names of viruses are, "Not a virus, Elite keylogger, trojan horse, and sometimes some random foreign words...
Viruses can make several pop-ups, take down your firewall, ruin your comp, take private info without a needed pass, record your mouse clicks, and more.
Viruses can be bad with some perm damage rarely, but you can spot one and delete it before too much gets gone.
The signs of a virus.
Several unstoppable pop-ups. Starts when you start your internet. They will continue until your comp just shuts down, freezez, or goes blue screen on you.
Slow-ness. Your computer will go slower than it usually does. If it does then scan your computer to make sure you have no virus. The slowness is the virus taking and changing your personal info. !Remember! Scan your computer weekly/monthly to check for viruses before they can do some REAL damage.
Changes on your computer. Sometimes you will see changed that you/your family hasent made. Well your new room mate, a virus, will change stuff just to get you mad for fun. They will change/delete your files so that they are hard to find. If you see any changes u didnt make or authorize, scan your computer.
There are more, but you will be able to spot them out if you can get the stuff above.
What to do.
Your joking right? Well if you dont know what to do, just first. SCAN YOUR COMPUTER. If you have a virus, its obvious, delete it. Unless you like having your computer messed up and you want someone doing this then go ahead keep it. Im no computer doctor but if you keep it on your computer ur personal files will be fed, deleted, and your computer will turn into crap and youll got to either nuke it [restart it] or just get a new one and give the infected one to your friend for a prank.
Keylogger, DO NOT TYPE ANY PASSWORDS, EMAILS, CREDIT CARD NUMBERS, OR ANY OTHER PRIVATE NUMBERS. They will just be sent to the keylogger sender. Just scan your computer with a special virus scanner to find and delete it. Then scan after its gone to make sure its gone for good. To avoid a keylogger just scan/delete any bad/unknown emails and stay off bad sites. To see if its bad get a virus system or somethign that has a site rater. It will tell you if its bad, moderate, unsafe, or serious. Well this is mine. Some will also give you a reason why its bad and sometimes redirect your comp to their main site to tell you its bad and if you wish to overide it. Also, stay off pr0n sites. They have viruses dude. Just go buy a playboy if your lonely.
For others just delete te virus before it cuases bad damage and delete bad files and stay off bad sites.
REMEMBER, scan ALL items before downloaded. Including emails. Keyloggers/trojans are sent over emails 82-90% of the time.
Vids of victims with viruses...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b77165ykOHM <-- Just a good tut vid http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=splFjjjtS3w <-- Example of what u should do http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Id_kGL3M5Cg <-- Tut of what will happen if u prank other with it.

item.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
item.dc:creator: @D3athtousall D3athtousall
item.description:
@D3athtousall wrote:

2 things,

1 I ment the mag, not site.

2 Put in a 3rd vid to show what happens when you send a virus to ur friend.

Read full topic

item.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

[quote=“D3athtousall, post:6, topic:154005”]W/e.

All I know is tht playboy doesnt give you viruses…[/quote]
thats becuz thats a big company that doesn’t need to distribute spyware/adware to make money.

item.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
item.dc:creator: @dragonus18 dragonus18
item.description:
@dragonus18 wrote:

[quote=“3.65 kilos, post:3, topic:154005”]Downloading porn isn’t the only way to get viruses, dragonus…

And D3athtoussel, some of what you described sounds like spyware. Add that they will need to download an Anti-Virus and/or Anti-spyware program.[/quote]
no but it’s one of the big factors of how most people ages 12-20 get them, and thats around the ages of the people on these forums, plus with all of us being on the comp the greater half of the day we will be more likely to jack off while looking at porn, thus maybe even downloading some, thus, maybe getting their computer infected.

Read full topic
item.source: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]

item.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
item.dc:creator: @D3athtousall D3athtousall
item.description:
@D3athtousall wrote:

Well yeah. But it still like viruses. Just that spyware worse.

I had virus for bout, year. Did bout nothing to me…

Nothing happened but I was slower.

Ex: Open internet, takes what, 4-15 sec longer than it does without one??

Rofl.

Read full topic
item.source: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]

item.title: How to tell if your comp is infected? [In english]
item.dc:creator: @3.65_kilos 3.65 kilos
item.description:
@3.65_kilos wrote:

Downloading porn isn’t the only way to get viruses, dragonus…

And D3athtoussel, some of what you described sounds like spyware. Add that they will need to download an Anti-Virus and/or Anti-spyware program.

Read full topic
